It also looks ugly - shouldn't the space name be after the page name?

See screenshot.

fields.description:
In IE:
1. Attach a document. I used "title  02.jpg" (with multiple spaces).
2. Edit the page and click create link (I did this in wiki markup editing, but I assume it works the same in both)
3. Go to the attachments tab and click the "title 02.jpg" link
4. The filename will go in the link box with only 1 space (^title 02.jpg).
5. click okay then save the page.
6. Link shows up as broken.

fields.summary: After moving page, in-page attachment links display referencing old space
ChildPositionComparator uses invalid equality check

fields.description:
In confluence 3.0.1 "height:1%" css hack was added at minimum to these files:
* conf-webapp/src/main/webapp/includes/css/master-ie.css
* conf-webapp/src/main/webapp/includes/css/comments-ie.css

I suppose that this change was made to solve some IE specific issue, but unfortunately this hack, makes it really easy to break the layout by making small customizations to the html or css.

Our css gurus suggested to replace "height:1%" with "zoom:1", which in IE has the same effect, except for adding new headaches and problems.

This blogpost explains the background for zoom:1 hack: http://www.bennadel.com/blog/1354-The-Power-Of-ZOOM-Fixing-CSS-Issues-In-Internet-Explorer.htm

When I made the changes in our build, our problems have disappeared and as far as I can tell no new issues were introduced.
fields.summary: IE css hack easily breaks layout (PATCH)

fields.description:
From [this thread|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257317879] on the Confluence Forum:

{quote}
I am testing an upgrade from 2.9 to 3.0.1, and can't seem to use the default theme in spaces unless it is set as the site-wide theme in 3.0.1.
Previously, in 2.9, I had set left navigation as the site-wide default. For any space, I could simply select the original default theme as one of the options. In 3.0.1, I am only given 3 options: use default (which is still set to the site-wide theme of left navigation), sharepoint decorators, clickr, or left navigation. It seems the only way I can use the default theme is to set it as the site-wide theme.
This is problematic, however, because it would mean that we would have to go to each space that was previously using the left navigation theme through site wide default, and manually change it to left navigation. We have many spaces set up for groups in our facility, and this would be a lot of effort.
Did I miss something, or is there another way to do this?

Thanks 
{quote}
fields.summary: Unable to set default theme at space level when another theme is set as site-wide theme
Document the change of behaviour for the recently updated macro in 3.0
Make custom CSS more like templates

fields.description:
*symptom*
In the UI, the reindex job makes it partway through, then skips to 99%, then completes. No errors appear in atlassian-confluence.log (besides perhaps some common word doc reindex issues).

*cause*
If a row has been deleted from the content table but an attachment row still references it, the indexing thread can fail. If there are enough references to the deleted row, the entire reindex job can fail.

*diagnosis*
If you're checking to see if this issue affects you, try:
select * from ATTACHMENTS where PAGEID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT); 
select * from LINKS where CONTENTID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT); 
select * from BODYCONTENT where CONTENTID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT);

*Steps to replicate:*
# Set up Confluence against a MySQL database using MySAM instead of InnoDB. Otherwise, you'll have to drop the referential constraints.
# Delete several rows on the content table
# Run the reindexing job. 

With enough of these, all the reindexing threads will quit and the job never finishes. 

The catalina.out log shows errors like:
{noformat}Exception in thread "Indexer: 3" org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateObjectRetrievalFailureException: No row with the given identifier exists: 32769, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.UnresolvableObjectException: No row with the given identifier exists: 32769, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.UnresolvableObjectException: No row with the given identifier exists: 32769, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject
	at net.sf.hibernate.UnresolvableObjectException.throwIfNull(UnresolvableObjectException.java:38)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.internalLoad(SessionImpl.java:1964)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.ManyToOneType.resolveIdentifier(ManyToOneType.java:69)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.EntityType.resolveIdentifier(EntityType.java:208)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.initializeEntity(SessionImpl.java:2219)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.initializeEntitiesAndCollections(Loader.java:319)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQuery(Loader.java:309)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections(Loader.java:138)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doList(Loader.java:1063)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.list(Loader.java:1054)
	at net.sf.hibernate.hql.QueryTranslator.list(QueryTranslator.java:854)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1554)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1531)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1523)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:592)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate$CloseSuppressingInvocationHandler.invoke(HibernateTemplate.java:1123)
	at $Proxy79.find(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.persistence.hibernate.HibernateAnyTypeDao$3.doInHibernate(HibernateAnyTypeDao.java:98)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.executeFind(HibernateTemplate.java:341)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.persistence.hibernate.HibernateAnyTypeDao.findByIdsAndClassName(HibernateAnyTypeDao.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ObjectQueue.pop(ObjectQueue.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultObjectQueueWorker$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(DefaultObjectQueueWorker.java:57)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultObjectQueueWorker.run(DefaultObjectQueueWorker.java:50)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:651)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:676)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:613)
{noformat}

*workaround*
Delete the problematic rows:
1) DELETE from ATTACHMENTDATA where ATTACHMENTID in (SELECT ATTACHMENTID from ATTACHMENTS where PAGEID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT));
2)
DELETE from ATTACHMENTS where PAGEID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT);
DELETE from LINKS where CONTENTID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT);
DELETE from BODYCONTENT where CONTENTID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT);
DELETE FROM CONFANCESTORS WHERE DESCENDENTID not in (select CONTENTID from CONTENT);
fields.summary: Index job fails due to HibernateObjectRetrievalFailureException

fields.description:
The bundled themes (clickr + lefthand nav) require immediate attention as they have a number of bugs that makes them unusable.

There are few related issues, three of them are documented [here|https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1769406844], but if you just take a quick look at each of those themes you will know what I'm referring to.

I would be glad to provide more specifics if need-be, but because there are many related issues, the sensible thing would be to have QA test this.

Just let me know if I can help by providing further details.
fields.summary: Connie needs pretty and functional clothes - Bundled Themes Require Attention

fields.description:
In the Administration >> Manage Referrers screen, URLs of some patterns can't be deleted. 

*steps to replicate*
# In Manage Referrers, add a URL pattern with a + in the name (like old Confluence URLs)
# Try to delete the referrer

*Workaround*:

You can delete these entries manually from the bandana table. One nice way (use carefully - this is not a tested plugin) is the [bandana editor|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Bandana+Editor]. Otherwise, try:
bq. SELECT BANDANAVALUE from bandana WHERE BANDANAKEY = 'atlassian.confluence.settings';

Find the xml for excludedReferrers. Delete the contents, then run:
bq. UPDATE bandana SET BANDANAVALUE = '<insert modified text>' where BANDANAKEY = 'atlassian.confluence.settings';
fields.summary: Unable to delete referrers with some characters like +

Best Regards,

fields.description:
Currently there's a yellow alert in the admin page:

{quote}
Warning: Your Confluence installation is currently configured to run daily automatic backups. We do not recommend the automatic backup procedure for production installations, as it may require a large amount of memory, CPU and disk space.
Instead, we recommend that you perform a manual backup of your Confluence database, home directory and attachments. For more information, please refer to our online documentation.
Once you have set up a daily manual backup procedure, you should disable Confluences automatic backup by going to Administration > Daily Backup Admin > Edit > Disable > Save. 
{quote}

This isn't strong enough. We should actually go to the extent of disabling the backup by default, then use the same kind of warning in the footer that we have for HSQLDB. Each of the DB docs should include notes about backing up the file system - we should redo our docs with this approach.
fields.summary: Alert users when XML backup needs disabling

fields.description:
Page restrictions, when applied to large spaces, can cause significant performance problems (instance becomes inoperable) due to the need to reindex every page (including every attachment). We've only recently begun to diagnose this in support, but we suspect it's been a problem for some time (based on the high frequency of incidents since learning what to look for). 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Restrictions+Performance+Considerations

*Implementation notice*
The solution to this issue is to batch the contentns of the index queue. That way Confluence should remain responsive while re-indexing. The batch size defaults to 1500 so it should be large enough that most instances do not need to adjust it. However should you wish to adjust the batch size it is possible by passing -Dindex.queue.batch.size=1500 (replacing 1500 with your desired batch size).
fields.summary: Page Restriction design does not scale well due to re-indexing of all sub-pages

fields.description:
Currently, our list of supported application servers suggests that customers may need to "upgrade to a supported version" if there are problems:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/List+Of+Supported+Application+Servers

This wording only addresses people running too old a version.  We tend to take a while to support new versions of Websphere, Weblogic, etc., often the latest version is not the one we suggest people use.   The wording should reflect this and not use the word "upgrade" at all.  I would suggest revising all of the variations on this page (for each version of Confluence) to say "migrate to a supported version" instead.
fields.summary: Clarify wording for "supported application servers"

fields.description:
Often when I come across a page or blog post in Confluence that I want to comment on, I'd love to know who is actually watching that page or blog so I know if those users that I want to see my comment or edit will actually get notified of it.

It would be awesome if we could put somewhere on the page/blog a section called *Watchers* which would list all those users that are watching the page, like we currently do in the Profile sidebar on a user's personal space.

Imagine if we had a sidebar for each page or blog that looked like the image attached.

*Notes*

* Hover Profile would work when hovering over a user's profile picture
* When you click on the _More_ link for _Recent Comments_ you should be taken to the top of the comments for that page/blog
* When you click on the _More_ link for _Recent Edits_ you should be taken to the _Page History_
fields.summary: List Watchers in sidebar for pages/blogs

fields.description:
After I upgraded our Confluence to 3.0.1, the Comments view broke in IE7. It shows just fine in IE8 and Firefox 3.5. I imagine it's a CSS problem? I tried to look for similar issues on the Confluence forums, in Jira, and with a Google search. Found nothing similar.

Edit: Apparently it is the *fancybox web resources* macro of the Advanced Macros plugin that causes this issue. Disabling this macro fixes the problem so that you can view all comments correctly. However, you lose the functionality of collapsing/expanding a single comment. The gallery plugin also seems to rely on this macro, since thumbnails generated by it don't open a lightbox effect anymore, but instead just link to the image.

I hope this issue is fixed quickly as the gallery plugin is widely used in our Confluence instance!

Cheers.
fields.summary: Comments view breaks in IE7 after Confluence 3.0.1 upgrade

fields.description:
If you have imported a lot of information into confluence (say via mediawiki importer), then you will have a lot of content that needs to be indexed, which can result in 

{noformat}
Exception in thread "DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-5" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at com.mysql.jdbc.TimeUtil.fastTimestampCreate(TimeUtil.java:1134)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.fastTimestampCreate(ResultSetImpl.java:1030)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetRow.getTimestampFast(ResultSetRow.java:1310)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ByteArrayRow.getTimestampFast(ByteArrayRow.java:124)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.getTimestampInternal(ResultSetImpl.java:6617)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.getTimestamp(ResultSetImpl.java:5943)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.getTimestamp(ResultSetImpl.java:5981)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyResultSet.getTimestamp(NewProxyResultSet.java:3394)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.TimestampType.get(TimestampType.java:27)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.NullableType.nullSafeGet(NullableType.java:62)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.NullableType.nullSafeGet(NullableType.java:53)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.AbstractType.hydrate(AbstractType.java:67)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.hydrate(Loader.java:690)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.loadFromResultSet(Loader.java:631)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.instanceNotYetLoaded(Loader.java:590)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.getRow(Loader.java:505)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.getRowFromResultSet(Loader.java:218)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQuery(Loader.java:285)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections(Loader.java:138)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doList(Loader.java:1063)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.list(Loader.java:1054)
	at net.sf.hibernate.hql.QueryTranslator.list(QueryTranslator.java:854)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1554)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.QueryImpl.list(QueryImpl.java:49)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate$20.doInHibernate(HibernateTemplate.java:731)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.find(HibernateTemplate.java:717)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.find(HibernateTemplate.java:700)
	at bucket.search.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateIndexQueueEntryDao.getNewEntries(HibernateIndexQueueEntryDao.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.queue.DatabaseIndexTaskQueue.getUnflushedEntries(DatabaseIndexTaskQueue.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.queue.DatabaseIndexTaskQueue.flushQueue(DatabaseIndexTaskQueue.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.flushQueue(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:93)
{noformat}

Looking at the heap memory dump (screen shot attached), most of the memory is taken up by the result set return from the database. 

This is because we {{bucket.search.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateIndexQueueEntryDao.getNewEntries}} request all new index entry items:

{code:xml}
select * from INDEXQUEUEENTRIES where CREATIONDATE > ? order by CREATIONDATE, ENTRYID;
{code}

Which can be huge for customers who have imported a large amount of content in. 

We should limit the number of rows that we request, then loop until we have got all entries that need to be indexed.
fields.summary: A large number of entries that need to flushed in the index can cause OutOfMemory errors

fields.description:
We've seen this issue in 2.7.3 loaded under Websphere 6.1 with Java 1.5 as well.  I'm pretty sure under 2.10.3, but I haven't confirmed recently.

The issue can be recreated by the following steps:
# Create a page
# Add a number of personal and standard labels (i.e. my:<label> or just making it a favorite)
# Copy the page to another name/space
# Review the label list
#* Anything that was personal my:<label> will simply be label now

We had noticed this after a number of pages started appearing with the label favourite which was unexpected.  Tracked it back down to the copy page functionality.

I would expect that personal labels would not copy at all.  Copying standard labels seems fine and can be useful under some circumstances.
fields.summary: Copying a page with personal labels converts them into standard labels

fields.description:
The edit window is cut off when the screen display is 1024x768. Happens in Firefox only.

Steps to replicate (Confluence 3.0.1):
# Set the screen resolution to 1024x768.
# In Firefox (3.5.2), try to add a page.

Notice that the name in the upper right is accurate, but the size of the edit window is cut off. Dragging the window out to the right solves the display problem.
fields.summary: edit screen does not wrap in addpage.action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16794].
  {panel}

There are new Confluence distributions. Find them on 'view all' from the dowloads page.

A [comment from Andrew L|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-36420?focusedCommentId=664851&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_664851]:

{quote}
This was forced upon us by external factors (Oracle demanded that we change the way we use our Coherence license). It had to be implemented for a stable release due to time constraints on the new licensing scheme.

We detail the changes [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+3.0.1+Upgrade+Notes], but it appears the other two links do not include a reference to this (important) change. 
{quote}

The other two links in question would be:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+a+Confluence+Cluster
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Cluster+Installation

Perhaps this has been started?
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Technical+Overview+of+Clustering+in+Confluence+-+copy+for+Coherence+changes
The tech overview should explain the specific distinctions between the distros, and we may need an FAQ or section of a page that explains what to do if you've got the wrong distribution
fields.summary: Document new cluster distributions

fields.description:
There's a gap between Confluence's data model and the constraints defined in its database schema. This gap allows duplicate records to be created where they shouldn't be, with consequences ranging from annoying log messages to messy failures.

It would nice to have a plugin that would run a set of queries to check for such constraints and report the conflicting table rows.
fields.summary: Confluence data integrity checker plugin
